document_title: Nasopharyngeal cancer: Causes, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
For nasopharyngeal cancer, the doctor must perform a clinical examination, identify the causative agents (with or without HPV) and combine a number of paraclinical tests to estimate the likelihood of disease spread. The tumor must be identified by histological results.
Imaging tests also contribute to disease staging. The stage of nasopharyngeal cancer can be classified from stage 0 to stage IV or from stage I to stage IV depending on the location of the lesion and the causative agent. (4)
subsection_title: ung thu vom hong.json. Stages of nasopharyngeal melanoma
